title: (x) New York magazine geometric constructed display type - custom type by Omnivore {Ricardo Cordoba}
content:
Hi. Can anyone ID the main font used in these spreads. or anything similar to it.

thanks guys.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [newyork2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822153118/http:/typophile.com/files/newyork2.jpg) | 182.86 KB |
| [newyork1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822153118/http:/typophile.com/files/newyork1.jpg) | 183.92 KB |
author: cuttin shapes

comments.content:
Don't know, don't have much time. But if you like that black style I'd recommend a look at identifonts search with the key [»Font similar to Black Boton Bold«](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822153118/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?5DD) or the excellent Fontfeed-Feature from Stephen Coles [»Extra Bold to Ultra Black Fonts«](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822153118/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/), especially the category »The Blackest« (Scroll down).

BTW, without the redirect-thingamajig it is verryvery easy for us users outside the USA to visit the fontshop.com-fontfeed. Wasn't always as comfortable. Thanks.
That's custom type created by [Omnivore](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822153118/http:/www.omnivorous.org/). They are credited in that issue.
thanks. I don't own the mag just seen photos of it.I really like that v it looks like a flower.
You're welcome! Do check out those links Renko posted for similar work.
